header.name: chaos/preprocessor/control/while_aux.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a looping construct.

macro.abstract: The macro iterates a state with a user-specified operation while a user-specified predicate expands to 1.

param.para:
The predicate that determines whether the loop should continue. This predicate must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
pred(s, data†, state‡)

† If the auxiliary data is parenthetic, the data pseudo-parameter must be the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of sub-elements in the auxiliary data. Otherwise, it must be a single parameter.
‡ The state pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the initial state, __VA_ARGS__.

The operation used to iterate the state. This operation must be either a or a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
op(s, data†, state‡)

† If the auxiliary data is parenthetic, the data pseudo-parameter must be the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of sub-elements in the auxiliary data. Otherwise, it must be a single parameter.
‡ The state pseudo-parameter must be either ... or the number of parameters that corresponds to the number of arguments in the initial state, __VA_ARGS__.

usage.param: Auxiliary data to be passed through the algorithm to the predicate and the operation. This argument may be either a parenthetic expression of any arity or a non-parenthetic expression.

pred(s, data, state)

The operation used to iterate the state. This operation must be a macro name that refers to a macro with a signature compatible with the following pseudo-signature:
op(s, data, state)
Auxiliary data to be passed through the algorithm to the predicate and the operation. This argument may be either a unary parenthetic expression or a non-parenthetic expression.
The initial state of the loop.

macro.para: The macro itself expands to a in terms of (s). This , when invoked by , expands to the result of repeatedly applying the operation to the state until the predicate expands to 0.

Both the predicate and the operation are invoked with the current (s), the auxiliary data (data), and the current state (state or __VA_ARGS__). The predicate must expand to either 0, 1, or a in terms of (s) that expands to either 0 or 1. If it expands to 0, the loop terminates, and the algorithm expands to the current state. Otherwise, the operation is applied to the current state to yield a new state or a in terms of (s) that yields a new state, and the loop continues.

The auxiliary data, data, is treated differently depending on whether it is parenthetic. If data is non-parenthetic, it is passed directly to the predicate and the operation as a single argument. In C99, if data is a parenthetic expression of any arity, its sub-elements are passed to the predicate and the operation as individual arguments. In C (prior to C99) and C++, if data is a unary parenthetic expression, its sub-element is passed to the predicate and the operation as a single argument (a parenthetic expression of any other arity is prohibited).
Ignoring the complexity of pred and the op (which are invoked, at most, once per loop iteration), each loop iteration requires only a single .
This macro deduces the current and invokes . If the current is already known, direct use of is more efficient.
